page.title: 06Buildings
page.content: {Lullington is a small village close to {the edge of Orchardleigh Park. It has {a lovely l3th. cent. church with {beautifully carved north doorway with {a tympanum showing the tree of life. } The original Norman church was built between 1070-ll00. The font is the most decorated one in Somerset. {Orchardleigh} has a church on an island in the middle of a lake. The church consists of a nave and chancel, with a rebuilt south porch. Outside, at the edge of the lake is the grave of Sir Henry Newbolt the poet. The church was built in about the middle of the 13th century.The original Manor house was pulled down in 1856 and the present house built 1855-58 by Thomas Henry Wyatt. It is picturesque, irregular and in a mixed Elizabethan style. Ann White (10)
